page.title: 17BUCKLEBURY-SCOTLAND
page.content: An area of open common land and woodland. The people who live in this area have commoners rights to gather firewood. The woodland is managed and is a mixture of oak, beech, silver birch and conifers. Carbins Wood has just been bought by the North Moor Trust in 1985 and there are plans to make a nature trail. St.Anns fruit farm is run as part of a unit for young people with special needs. The soft fruit grown include raspberries and strawberries. The apple orchard is being cut down this year as it as proved uneconomic. All the people on the farm are paid the same wages. There are four community service volunteers and ten young people working on the farm.
